alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; North Laramie Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 21 at 3:46PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Albany and west central Platte Counties through 430 PM MDT... At 345 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles east of Wheatland Reservoir 3, or 28 miles west of Wheatland, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Albany and west central Platte Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM MDT for southeastern Wyoming.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; North Laramie Range
